title: Calendar: Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015
text:
Calendar: Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 From staff reports, pnj.com 10:52 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Health calendar 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Today 
Drive-By Truckers in concert Vinyl Music Hall, 2 S. Palafox St. 7 p.m. today. Drive-By Truckers are an alternative country/Southern rock band based in Athens, Ga., though two out of five current members are originally from The Shoals region of Northern Alabama, and the band strongly identifies with Alabama. Tickets: $25 to $30 at the Vinyl Music Hall box office or online at www.vinylmusichall.com or www.ticketfly.com. All ages are welcome, but there is a $5 surcharge for those younger than 21. 
Santa Rosa County Storytime 11 a.m. Tuesdays, Navarre Library, 8484 James M. Harvell Road. For 3- to 5-year-olds who are able to attend without a caregiver. 981-7323, www.santarosa.fl.gov/libraries. 
Five Flags Sertoma Club Pensacola Bay Center, 201 E. Gregory St. Noon Tuesdays. Interesting and inspiring speakers will touch on a range of topics. The club helps local kids make wonderful memories by aiding their hearing and speech. Richard Forsley, 291-2916, rt@forsleyproperties.us. 
Friends of the Gulf Breeze Library Board Meeting Gulf Breeze Library, 1060 Shoreline Drive. 5 p.m., the second Tuesday. www.facebook.com/friendsofgblibrary. 
Sweet Adelines International Performance Opportunity Program Heights Baptist Church, 600 Pickens Ave. 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. Tuesdays until Christmas. Pensacola Sound Chapter of Sweet Adelines International invites women of all ages who are interested in singing Christmas music to participate in their Performance Opportunity Program. Group vocal instruction and opportunities to sing four-part a cappella harmony in the organization’s Christmas performances will be offered. Free. (888) 611-SING. visitor@pensacolasoundchorus.com. 
The Pensacola Civil War Roundtable First Christian Church - DOC, 6031 Goodrich Drive and Langley Ave. 7 p.m. today. The Pensacola Civil War Roundtable’s October meeting will feature Robert Bradley, chief curator of the Alabama Department of Archives & History. From 1974 through 1986 he served as historian with the National Park Service. Bradley will discuss the preservation, documentation, and conversation of his department’s half-million artifacts. 968-6094. 
Women Veteran Advisory Committee West Florida Public Library, 239 N. Spring St. 6 p.m., the second Tuesday. Women Veterans are invited to be a part of the Northwest Florida Women Veteran Advisory Committee. Debra Russell, 602-4606, debrar.gcvac@gmail.com. 
Cribbage Club No. 396 of Pensacola Sanders Beach-Corinne Jones Community Center, 913 South I St. 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tuesdays. The club is recruiting new, experienced cribbage players, for their nine game-tournament style sets. They are affiliated with the American Cribbage Conference, which establishes the rules of play. Jon Pettigrew, 221-2642, tropicalmotion@cox.net. 
Family History Research West Florida Genealogy Library, 5740 N. Ninth Ave. 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays. West Florida Genealogical Society volunteers are available to assist you in exploring your roots. 494-7373. 
Flamingos Flock Milton Simply Southern, 5165 Canal St., Milton. 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesday through Saturday in October. To mark breast cancer awareness month, the gardens of the historic house/shop are “flocked” with flamingos. Individuals can tag a flamingo with a $10 donation. Becky Smith, 626-8215. 
Meet the Artist A Special Place: Gifts, Home Decor, & More, 1900 U.S. 87, Suite H, Navarre. 5 to 7 p.m. Tuesday. Meet the artist at a Special Place. Michelle Massey, 368-9500, aspecialplace.98@gmail.com. www.aspecialplacenavarre.com. 
Milton Community Center Activities Guy Thompson Community Center, 5629 Byrom St., Milton. 8:30 a.m. Monday through Friday. The Milton Community Center is hosting a variety of activities including card games, line dancing, pickleball, yoga, ballroom dancing, Tai Chi, movies, bingo, tennis, chair aerobics/yoga, and a meeting of the Panhandle Writer’s Group. Bill Gamblin, 983-5466, bill.gamblin@ci.milton.fl.us, www.ci.milton.fl.us. 1 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.pnj.com/1RDJbo6 More Stories
